column1: 10 pts - You clearly identified a business function that could benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies and provided a detailed explanation of how it could operate for that function. Great job!
10 pts - Some vagueness in description, but largely OK. Good effort in identifying suitable business functions for scrum/sprint and kanban methodologies.

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good attempt at explaining why kanban is not suitable for certain functions, but could be more specific and clear in your reasoning.
10/10 - Great job identifying the business functions that could benefit from kanban methodologies and providing clear explanations. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job explaining the benefits and application of kanban in various business functions. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good effort in discussing the business functions and methodologies, but the explanation of why scrum/sprint is a poor fit for certain functions could be clearer and more specific. Keep up the good work!

4 pts - Not really clear that this bias is relevant to the situation.

Comment: You mentioned overconfidence bias, but it's not clearly connected to the decision-making process about moving to agile. Try to provide a more specific example of how this bias could impact the decision and suggest steps to avoid it.

6 pts - Noticeable errors or misunderstanding in the definition. 

Your description of overconfidence bias is somewhat accurate, but it could be clearer and more concise. Make sure to focus on defining the bias itself rather than discussing its potential impact on Mighty Jaxx.
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job on providing a detailed analysis of the business functions and potential cognitive biases. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Reasonable description, but missing some detail. Good effort in identifying suitable business functions for Scrum and Kanban methodologies, but could provide more specific steps or actions for implementation. Keep up the good work!
